info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 9:35AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following county, Columbiana. Portions of western Pennsylvania, including the following county, Beaver. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area shortly. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Liverpool, Beaver Falls, Wellsville, Calcutta, Ohioville, Midland, Chester, Industry, Shippingport, Patterson Township, Newell, Patterson Heights, Georgetown, Hookstown, Glasgow, La Croft, Glenmoor and Beaver Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
